title: [London] Double check the routing network
body:
I think based on the German settings, "primary" roads are excluded from the walking & cycling network.
In London, it seems like this road category has a bit of a different meaning. 

For example, this is a primary road that seems to also have sidewalks: 
https://www.openstreetmap.org/way/245866919#map=18/51.49719/-0.10963
I guess this is the case for most of the primary roads in London.

title: Info texts for Line and Area Measurement are faulty
body:
### Summary 📃

In the Line and Area Measurement functionality, the info texts are containing some faults. Mainly the German translations are wrong but also one English text should be improved.

### Expected Behaviour ✔

Correct language

### Current Behaviour 🔦

Faulty language

### Possible Solution 💡

**GERMAN TEXTS:**
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49870195/219706864-53cb6366-e3ec-40db-b37f-64967c3136aa.png)
This rather should be:
- "Klicken, um Startpunkt für Längenmessung festzulegen" for lines
- "Klicken, um Startpunkt für Flächenmessung festzulegen" for areas

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49870195/219707334-93e03d2b-b749-44b7-a6af-4fe98fa57a9b.png)
This rather should be "Fläche"

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49870195/219707416-f09d2865-56a2-4064-8eec-299e02f38bc6.png)
This rather should be: 
- "Doppelklick, um Vorgang zu Beenden" for lines
- "Doppelklick oder Klick auf Startpunkt, um Vorgang zu Beenden" for areas


**ENGLISH TEXTS:**
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49870195/219707907-25cdbdf9-9975-4929-99e2-35f88a93ba72.png)
This only makes sense for areas. For lines, this rather should be "Double-click to finish"

### Steps to reproduce 👣

<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug. Include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1. Open GOAT
2. Click on the measurement button
3. Start measurement and get confused by wrong labels ;) 



### Possible Implementation 📐

_No response_

title: POI icons are having an offset when zooming out
body:
### Summary 📃

I like that the POI icons now still appear when zooming out and adjust their size! How is their position calculated? 
Currenty, the icons appear with an offset between the actual location and the marker. 
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49870195/200480752-76601bd0-ae3d-4986-9aed-aa4b0f5965fd.png)

### Expected Behaviour ✔

Markers point on the exact locations

### Current Behaviour 🔦

Markers don't point on the exact locations

### Possible Solution 💡

Adjust the offset? 

### Steps to reproduce 👣

<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug. Include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1. open GOAT
2. activate POIs
3. zoom out
4. activate background map as a reference to see the "real" locations

title: The overlay in the map isn't updated properly for the isochrone
body:
If we have 5 isochrones and we delete isochrone number 2,3,4 then the 5th isochrone should be renamed as the second one. In the sidebar and icon it works well but when we hover over it, it displays the old isochrone number.
![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60944813/199958977-536b0ca3-56cb-4fd1-aa75-391ac6fac35d.png)

title: [BUG] Change Page Order of Information Pop-Up
body:
### Summary 📃

The pop-up with the information about the hexagon is currently the first one, but it would be more intuitive for the user if the information about the POI is the first one as the user just clicked on the POI.

### Expected Behaviour ✔

The pop-up with the information about the POI should be the first one when clicking on a POI while a heat map is active.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/91256148/198594888-317d9fe6-fc6a-411c-aba9-c1e71d32b1f5.png)


### Current Behaviour 🔦

The pop-up with the information about the hexagon is currently the first one, but it would be more intuitive for the user if the information about the POI is the first one as the user just clicked on the POI.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/91256148/198594659-5346ae6e-e3c6-46a6-9ea8-886fc10f11ed.png)


### Possible Solution 💡

I think the get_info() function needs to be adjusted.

### Steps to reproduce 👣

1. Pick any POI
2. Activate any heatmap
3. Click on a POI



### Possible Implementation 📐

Change the page order of the information pop-up.

## Expected Behavior

There is a significant difference between the cartesian area calculated from the backend and the area of the measure tool in the client. The client uses Ol/Sphere.js method from OpenLayers, which is more accurate than Shapely. 

## Possible Solution
<!--- Not obligatory, but suggest a fix/reason for the bug, -->
Shapely doesn't support CRS so a workaround can be doing the intersection in PostGIS or having a custom python method.

title: Heatmap population does not reflect automatically
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Expected Behavior
When doing a scenario on a building, the heatmap does not get refreshed automatically after drawing a new building.
It is necessary to change the state from e.g., scenario to comparison to get the change is reflected.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42171996/184497479-a65bb861-39f5-4b3c-ba85-aebb60f4ab95.png)


<!--- Tell us what should happen -->

## Current Behavior
Heatmap does not get updated after something is changed on the building or building entrance layer.
<!--- Tell us what happens instead of the expected behavior -->

## Possible Solution
The same as for the Local accessibility heatmap. Run a call against the API when something was modified on the building layer. The slight complexity might be that the population gets only updated after the building entrance is drawn or if a building is deleted.

So it is proposed that the heatmap_population endpoint get called after some change happened for the building entrances or if a building is deleted. 

<!--- Not obligatory, but suggest a fix/reason for the bug, -->

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug. Include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1. Turn on population heatmap
2. Draw a scenario on the buildings layer
3. Check map

## Context (Environment)
Production and Dev

https://github.com/opening-hours/opening_hours.js/tree/master#nodejs-developer

title: Double check wheelchair classification
body:
I double checked the wheelchair classification in the course of working on #238.
There are many ways with no classification, so they are simply classified as 'Null'. 
I think we should double check the classification. 

I also adjusted a bit the part of the lit as it was not very performant.

title: If many layers are activated, it is sometimes not possible to click on the POIs
body: If many layers are activated (e.g. POIs, Multi-Isochrones and Layer "Illuminance"), it is not possible to click on the POIs and show the POIs information.

title: Text in Infobox is not displayed correctly
body: On the GOAT Website, the line breaks in the Infobox are not displayed correctly.

title: Preparation of buildings_residential.sql to work without custom landuse data
body: Some functions in GOAT are currently not working without custom landuse data, e.g. the population layer. The buildings_residential.sql file needs to be updated for working with OSM-landuse-data.

title: Delete features and re-calculate isochrone is not working
Check setup script
body: Not all DB functions where created. I think the issue happens when looped through the database_functions folder.

title: Scenario building for isochrone is not working properly
Walkability heatmaps and walking/population are not working
Check snapping behaviour for new pgrouting in dev-branch
Kindergartens are shown twice
body: If kindergartens are inserted in OSM as buildings + land use, GOAT will display two kindergarten symbols, although there is actually only one kindergarten (building + associated area). Screenshot of how it looks in OSM: Screenshot of how it looks in GOAT: (this example shows the "Gemeindekindergarten" in Langenbach) Solution idea: No symbol for the land use "Kindergarten" should be displayed if there is also a building "Kindergarten" in it.
